Cary,
I am one of those people!! I will take another look at art and the sw=
ord and try and eliminate my preconceptions. A couple of weeks ago I was lo=
oking at a Nobuie tsuba which was stunning. Mokko form with sukashi axe des=
ign. the colour of the iron was incredible.
Anyway thanks a lot for the inf=
ormation.
regards
paul

Cary Condell <condell@...> wrote:
Paul,
Tha=
nk you.

Many folks incorrectly limit their understanding
of Owari tsuba to=
 Owari Sukashi tsuba.
In fact, Owari tsuba-ko comprises a great deal
of non=
 sukashi work staring with Nobuie,
Yamakichibei, Hoan, Sadahiro etc.
Best b=
ook on the subject is Owari to Mikawa no Tsuba-Ko.

Also check the Art and =
the Sword, Vol. 3 (1990) pp. 2-53.
A Comprehensive Survey of Bishu Kinko by=
 Wakayama Komatsu.
(Prepared for the 14th NBTHK Zenkoku Taikai (annual conv=
ention,10/83)).
Pages 7-8 discusses Fukui Jizaemon. Plate 25 displays a
tsu=
ba by him which has strong affinities to mine.
(Mine is better IMHO).

Rega=
rds,
Cary Condell
